papers.title: 老年住院患者压疮风险评估及预防护理策略研究
papers.authors: 张明, 李华, 王芳
papers.abstract: 本研究通过对500例老年住院患者进行压疮风险评估，探讨了有效的预防护理策略。结果显示，综合护理干预可显著降低压疮发生率，提高患者生活质量。

papers.title: 不同体位管理对老年卧床患者压疮预防效果的系统评价
papers.authors: 刘伟, 陈静, 赵强
papers.abstract: 系统评价了12项随机对照试验，比较不同体位管理方法对压疮预防的效果。研究发现，30度侧卧位结合气垫床使用效果最佳。

papers.title: 基于物联网技术的智能压疮监测系统设计与应用
papers.authors: 王磊, 张敏, 李勇
papers.abstract: 设计开发了一套基于压力传感器的智能监测系统，能够实时监测患者体位压力分布，为压疮预防提供数据支持。临床应用显示系统有效可靠。

papers.title: 老年痴呆患者压疮护理的特殊挑战与对策
papers.authors: 陈芳, 刘明, 王华
papers.abstract: 针对老年痴呆患者压疮护理的特殊性，提出了个性化的护理方案。重点强调了沟通技巧、行为管理和家属参与的重要性。

papers.title: Pressure Ulcer Prevention in Older Adults: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis
papers.authors: Smith, J., Johnson, A., Brown, K.
papers.abstract: This systematic review and meta-analysis evaluated the effectiveness of pressure ulcer prevention strategies in older adults. Results showed significant reduction in pressure ulcer incidence with comprehensive prevention programs.

papers.title: Innovative Technologies for Pressure Injury Monitoring in Geriatric Care
papers.authors: Wilson, R., Davis, M., Thompson, P.
papers.abstract: This study explores the application of novel sensor technologies for real-time pressure injury monitoring in geriatric patients. The technology demonstrated high accuracy in predicting pressure injury risk.

papers.title: Nutritional Interventions for Pressure Ulcer Prevention in Frail Elderly: A Randomized Controlled Trial
papers.authors: Garcia, L., Martinez, S., Lee, J.
papers.abstract: This RCT investigated the effects of specialized nutritional supplementation on pressure ulcer prevention in frail elderly patients. The intervention group showed significantly lower pressure ulcer incidence.

papers.title: Economic Evaluation of Pressure Ulcer Prevention Programs in Long-Term Care Facilities
papers.authors: Chen, W., Park, S., Anderson, R.
papers.abstract: This economic analysis compared the cost-effectiveness of different pressure ulcer prevention programs in long-term care settings. Comprehensive prevention programs were found to be cost-effective.
